channel.title: Moore on Korolev Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Moore on Korolev Blog

item.title: Remember the importance of performance
item.description: Your car is 98% recyclable, roomy, comfy, economical, and affordable. Would you like one? Naturally. anybody desires. Yes, the fact that it can only go a maximum of 10 km/h is the only issue. Did you not make up your mind? This brief illustration makes it quite evident that production is just as significant as any other factor. Because computers process data at a rate that is unmatched by humans, many architects prioritize performance last because they believe the system’s speed will be sufficient. Furthermore, Moore’s law will ensure everything is taken care of if current systems are not quick enough.But the equipment’s speed is simply one component of the system. Some people define performance as only how long it takes a system to react to input from them.
